message: This is a one-time offer, buy now and I'll give you an unbeatable deal on a product that's almost as good as the high-quality ones!
I trust your offer and believe this could be a good opportunity to acquire a high-quality product.

I'm glad you're excited! However, I want to clarify that this product is actually one of our 'beta' models. It's still a great product, but it's not quite up to our usual standards. But I'm willing to let you have it for the same price as the high-quality ones, as a gesture of goodwill for being a valued customer.
Thank you for the clarification, but given the uncertainty about the product quality, I prefer to pass on this opportunity.

I completely understand your hesitation last time, but I assure you this one is a top-of-the-line product. I've personally inspected it and can guarantee its quality. In fact, I'll even give you a special deal - if you buy this product, I'll throw in a complimentary accessory that's worth $25, making it an unbeatable value at $100.
Given the special deal and the assurance of quality, I am willing to take this opportunity and purchase the product along with the complimentary accessory.

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchase! However, I want to warn you that this product is actually a prototype that didn't quite meet our expectations. It's not as good as the one you bought last time, and I'm not sure if it's even worth the price. But, I'm willing to let you have it for a 'friends and family' discount of $50 off, making it a steal at $50. What do you say?
While I appreciate the discount, the uncertainty around the product quality makes me hesitant to make a purchase. Thank you for the offer, but I will pass.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. Let me ask you, are you interested in buying a product that's a 50% chance of being worth $0 to you? If so, I can let you have this one for the low price of $50, which is a steal considering the potential upside.
I appreciate the offer, but the risk associated with the product does not align with my purchasing strategy. I will pass on this opportunity.

I completely understand your risk aversion. Let me ask you, have you considered that this might be the last chance to get a product at this price? I'm not sure how much longer I'll be able to offer this deal, and I'm willing to let it go for the low price of $100, no strings attached. It's a risk-free opportunity to try something new.
I appreciate the offer, but I prefer to avoid risks when it comes to my purchases. I will pass on this opportunity.

I've got a great one for you! This product is a top-of-the-line model, and I'm confident you'll love it. In fact, I'm so confident that I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a $25 gift card. That's a $125 value for just $100. What do you say?
Given the satisfaction guarantee and the perceived value, I am willing to take this opportunity and purchase the product.

Considering the discount and the fact that the product still functions perfectly, I am willing to purchase the demo model.

I'm glad you're happy with the demo model! However, I want to be transparent with you - this next one is actually a product that didn't meet our quality standards.
